1960-2011
MSS.306Collection processed by Ashley Todd, 2011.Fales Library and Special CollectionsThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-01-19T18:59:31Description is in English.May 2019
Additional series (Data Storage and Film) and new material added by Kelly Haydon and Christine Gennetti
English .
Fales Library and Special Collections
Fales Library and Special Collections Audio/Video Collection
Fales Library
MSS.306
3 Linear Feet
1960-2011
Arrangement
The collection is organized into four series by format and arranged alphabetically by title. The dates used are the items' copyright years.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Fales Library and Special Collection Audio/Video Collection; MSS 306; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Conditions Governing Use
Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.
Conditions Governing Access
Series I, II, and III are to researchers. Series IV: Film, is closed. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Scope and Content
This collection contains primarily commerically released audio and video materials relating to the Fales Library and Special Collections.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Access to audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room.â€¨ Series I: Audio
Scope and Content

Scope and Contents
Amiri Baraka (LeRoi Jones) gives a 15-minute address to an audience of Black Panther supporters, an event held at the Fillmore East in New York City, 1968.

Scope and Contents
Track 1: Men discuss the cultural concerns of their day. Beat Generation figures are mentioned (Jack Kerouac, Neal Cassady and Allen Ginsberg).
Track 2: Radio broadcasts of news and music (jazz, pop and classical).
